MOURINHO CONFIRMS FELLAINI ABSENCE

Jose Mourinho has confirmed that Marouane Fellaini will be absent for Saturday's Premier League clash away to Arsenal.

The Belgian international sustained a knee problem on international duty in October but returned to action against Chelsea last month and had featured in each of the Reds' subsequent three games prior to Tuesday's 4-2 win at Watford, which he missed through injury.

Speaking in his pre-match press conference at the Aon Training Complex on Friday, Mourinho was asked about the availability of Fellaini and his fellow midfielder Nemanja Matic, who was forced off in the second half at Vicarage Road.

The boss said: “Matic is a doubt, I hope he can [play] but I cannot guarantee he’s selected to go. Let’s see the feeling before the match, let's see the warm-up. I hope he can, he wants to [play] but I cannot guarantee. [Marouane] Fellaini is not travelling with the team.”

Fellaini has once again been an important figure for the Reds in the early part of the season, scoring four goals so far.

The Reds will be looking for a first away win over Arsenal since 2014, a result that would close the gap at the top of the table to five points before leaders Manchester City host West Ham United on Sunday.
